Date: 2025-08-11 15:02
Subject: Re: MLG Partnership - Legal Review

Hi Saadeddine, 

Thank you for your email. As mentioned in my earlier note (attached), the agreement currently does not include an insurance clause. Before we proceed, could you please confirm what insurance coverage, if any, is currently in place for this arrangement so we can ensure the agreement reflects the correct position?

Looping in @Hagop Ghazarian <mailto:Hagop.Ghazarian@chalhoub.com>  here for visibly and input. Once we have your confirmation and the Insurance team’s feedback, we can finalise the agreement.

________________________________

Hi Saadeddine, 

Please find attached both a clean and tracked version of the Custody Agreement for your review and confirmation.

We have included comments highlighted in yellow throughout the agreement that require your input. Appreciate of you can review and confirm your alignment with all commercial elements, including scope, duration, and termination.
Note that there is no clause covering insurance. Could you please clarify what insurance coverage, if any, is currently in place so we can reflect it in the agreement.
Once everything is aligned on your end, we will mirror the final agreed changes into the other agreement.
If you have any questions or would like to discuss any points further, feel free to reach out.
Best, 
Zain

From: Christopher Hurst <Christopher.Hurst@chalhoub.com>
Sent: Thursday, July 10, 2025 10:53 AM
To: Saadeddine Elnakib <Saadeddine.Elnakib@chalhoub.com>; Nehaal Kadge <Nehaal.Kadge@chalhoub.com>; Faraz Hasan <Faraz.hasan@chalhoub.com>; Mariel Yard <Mariel.Yard@chalhoub.com>
Cc: Zain Manna <Zain.Manna@chalhoub.com>
Subject: Re: MLG Partnership - Legal Review
 
Dear Saadeddine,

Hope you are well.

We have included our high-level comments below, but we suggest that you confirm the VAT and CT treatment with your external advisors. 


1.	
	We do not believe there should be a deemed supply from a VAT perspective as EV LABS are purely taking custody of the products for a short period of time and the company is not receiving any income from this arrangement.

2.	
	From a CT perspective, there is a risk that EV LABS will not be able to deduct any expenditure incurred in relation to this arrangement. This is because it could be argued that such expenditure is not incurred for the purposes of EV LABS' business. Additionally, please could you confirm whether EV LABS has registered for UAE Corporate Tax as I understand that the entity had not previously been registered?


Kind regards,
Chris

2.	
	From a CT perspective, there is a risk that EV LABS will not be able to deduct any expenditure incurred in relation to this arrangement. This is because it could be argued that such expenditure is not incurred for the purposes of EV LABS' business. Additionally, please could you confirm whether EV LABS has registered for UAE Corporate Tax as I understand that the entity had not previously been registered?


Kind regards,
Chris

CHRIS HURST​​​
Senior Manager ‑ TAX
M.C.T. FZE
DUBAI

UNITED ARAB EMIRATES

Hi Zain,

Just a quick addition for the agreement we’re reviewing:

I’d like to include a clause that allows us to exit the partnership without cause, with a minimum notice period requiring them to remove all their products from the space within one week. This ensures we retain flexibility in case we need to prioritize the space for another brand, especially considering they are not paying for the placement.

I’d like to include a clause that allows us to exit the partnership without cause, with a minimum notice period requiring them to remove all their products from the space within one week. This ensures we retain flexibility in case we need to prioritize the space for another brand, especially considering they are not paying for the placement.

We are still in the process of scheduling and assessing the value they bring, so this clause is important to protect our position.

Let me know your thoughts.

Regards,

Saadeddine

Hi Zain,

I hope all is well,

Please find attached sent by Hagop and additional details below:

*	This only covers vehicle that are not registered
*	Excludes vehicles that have motor insurance policy
*	There is cover for property in custody and control, but you need to be legally responsible for the loss for the policy to cover.
*	Damage to vehicle due to test drive not covered. Customer needs to sign document assuming responsiblity for any damages due to his actions, inactions or negligence.

Let us know if any other needs are required and if this suffices.

Appreciated!
Many thanks,

Saadeddine El Nakib

From: Christopher Hurst <Christopher.Hurst@chalhoub.com>
Sent: Thursday, July 10, 2025 10:53 AM

Cc: Zain Manna <Zain.Manna@chalhoub.com>
Subject: Re: MLG Partnership - Legal Review
 
Dear Saadeddine,

Hope you are well.

We have included our high-level comments below, but we suggest that you confirm the VAT and CT treatment with your external advisors. 


1.	
	We do not believe there should be a deemed supply from a VAT perspective as EV LABS are purely taking custody of the products for a short period of time and the company is not receiving any income from this arrangement.

2.	
	From a CT perspective, there is a risk that EV LABS will not be able to deduct any expenditure incurred in relation to this arrangement. This is because it could be argued that such expenditure is not incurred for the purposes of EV LABS' business. Additionally, please could you confirm whether EV LABS has registered for UAE Corporate Tax as I understand that the entity had not previously been registered?


Kind regards,
Chris

2.	
	From a CT perspective, there is a risk that EV LABS will not be able to deduct any expenditure incurred in relation to this arrangement. This is because it could be argued that such expenditure is not incurred for the purposes of EV LABS' business. Additionally, please could you confirm whether EV LABS has registered for UAE Corporate Tax as I understand that the entity had not previously been registered?


Kind regards,
Chris

This ensures we retain flexibility in case we need to prioritize the space for another brand, especially considering they are not paying for the placement.
